Enumeration Type Documentation

enum geometry::cd_selector

Cardinal directions.

They are used in the dms-class. When specified by the library user, north/east/south/west is, in general, enough. When parsed or received by an algorithm, the user knows it it is lat/long but not more

Enumerator:
north 
east 
south 
west 
cd_lat 
cd_lon 

enum geometry::connection_type

Enumeration containing connection types of intersected segments.

Enumerator:
is_connect_no 
is_connect_s1p1 
is_connect_s1p2 
is_connect_s2p1 
is_connect_s2p2 

enum geometry::dr_selector

Unit of plan angles: degrees or radians.

Enumerator:
degree 
radian 

enum geometry::init

Enumeration to initialize in constructor for point/envelope.

Enumerator:

init_min_infinite 
init_max_infinite 
init_inverse

template<typename T1 , typename T2 >
bool geometry::equals ( const T1 &  a,
const T2 &  b 
)

returns true if both arguments are equal.

equals returns true if both arguments are equal.

Parameters:
a first argument
b second argument
Returns:
true if a == b
Note:
If both a and b are of an integral type, comparison is done by ==. If one of the types is floating point, comparison is done by abs and comparing with epsilon.
